title: Designing Chemistry Multimedia Learning Environments to Foster Scientific Thinking

context.prior_knowledge: Grasp of basic chemistry concepts (atomic structure, chemical bonding, chemical reactions, etc.) and fundamental scientific inquiry methods
context.additional_context: Constructivist-based learning course emphasizing chemistry problem-solving and scientific thinking development. Conduct of interactive multimedia learning activities using digital devices.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze chemical problems through the scientific thinking process (observation-question-hypothesis-experiment-conclusion)
Learners can explain chemical concepts using multimedia resources (simulations, virtual labs, scientific language tools, etc.)

Over 2â€“4 weeks, learners communicate three or more times with peers and scientific communities during collaborative problem-solving activities (e.g., environmental issue inquiry projects), and submit communication records meeting two or more of three structured feedback criteria (clarity, respect, specificity)
Learners can present results by analyzing experimental data and utilizing scientific language (graphs, tables, argument structures)
Learners can enhance scientific reasoning skills by comparatively analyzing diverse chemical phenomena (lab cases, everyday examples)
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
